questiontext.text:
The \(3\times 3\) unit matrix is: \[ I = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 & 0 \\ 0 & 1 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 1 \end{bmatrix} \] and as in the \(2\times 2\) case this has the property that \( AI = IA = A \) for all matrices \(A\).

The \(3\times 3\) zero matrix is \[ \underline{0} = \begin{bmatrix} 0 & 0 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 0 \end{bmatrix} \]
